intro: Balsamita virgata, commonly known as Mexican balsam, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms from spring to early summer. Balsamita virgata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
